title: I was too poor to afford this
description:
Treat your feet with Vessi! Save 15% on your first order at http://vessi.com/LinusTechTips

Check out Ridge’s Father’s Day sale at https://www.ridge.com/LINUS and enjoy up to 40% off!

Sometimes PC DREAMS DO become reality! We’ve assembled high-end gaming parts of years past to build our top tier fantasy retro desktop rig. But there are a more than a few hiccups, and maybe our Dreams will transform into nightmares. Y2K more like WHY-2K? Either way, the 2001 Dream Machine from Maximum PC is here.

Discuss on the forum:  https://linustechtips.com/topic/1570820-i-was-too-poor-to-afford-this/

Check out Victor Bart and RETRO Machines here:  https://www.youtube.com/@victorbart

Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.

► GET MERCH: https://lttstore.com
► GET EXCLUSIVE CONTENT ON FLOATPLANE: https://lmg.gg/lttfloatplane
► SPONSORS, AFFILIATES, AND PARTNERS: https://lmg.gg/partners
► EQUIPMENT WE USE TO FILM LTT: https://lmg.gg/LTTEquipment
► OUR WAN PODCAST GEAR: https://lmg.gg/wanset

FOLLOW US 
---------------------------------------------------  
Twitter: https://twitter.com/linustech
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/LinusTech
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/linustech
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@linustech
Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/linustech

MUSIC CREDIT
---------------------------------------------------
Intro: Laszlo - Supernova
Video Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PKfxmFU3lWY
iTunes Download Link: https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/supernova/id936805712
Artist Link: https://soundcloud.com/laszlomusic

Outro: Approaching Nirvana - Sugar High
Video Link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ngsGBSCDwcI
Listen on Spotify: http://spoti.fi/UxWkUw
Artist Link: http://www.youtube.com/approachingnirvana

Intro animation by MBarek Abdelwassaa https://www.instagram.com/mbarek_abdel/
Monitor And Keyboard by vadimmihalkevich / CC BY 4.0  https://geni.us/PgGWp
Mechanical RGB Keyboard by BigBrotherECE / CC BY 4.0 https://geni.us/mj6pHk4
Mouse Gamer free Model By Oscar Creativo / CC BY 4.0 https://geni.us/Ps3XfE

CHAPTERS
---------------------------------------------------
0:00 Intro – CPU
1:00 Motherboard 
1:58 RAM
3:08 Case 
4:08 Why don’t they do this anymore?
5:06 The “Deathstar”
6:57 The Disk Drives
8:23 Power Supplies can be “NICE” too
9:21 GPU
10:00 Does it turn on? and also other Add-in Cards 
11:40 This Monitor is SICK
12:11 This Mouse and Keyboard are NOT
13:21 This Audio Setup still holds up today.
16:47 Playing Games – this thing can push THAT much?
transcript: This CPU is ancient technology by today's standards. One measly core clocked at just 1.8 gigahertz, but when I was in grade 9, this Pentium 4 processor was crowned the Benchmark Destroyer by Maximum PC Magazine. It ran Quake 3 at a blistering 226 frames per second. That... is 18% faster than the very best that AMD could muster at the time, though it would have cost you an extra 450 today dollars for the privilege. Now, at that point in my life, my only source of income was the shiny loonie that my parents would give me for each wheelbarrow of manure that I hauled to the garden. So, to say that this would have been out of reach for me would be a gross understatement. And even if I could afford the CPU... There is no way that I would have been able to obtain the supporting cast, starting with this premium Asus P4T motherboard with both software and hardware overclocking controls. One day, I told myself, one day, the price of all of this will come down and I will build a dream machine of my very own. Well, guess what, folks? It's one's day, and the pile around me might not look it. But in September of 2001, this was Maximum PC's dream gaming machine build. "Dream" being an excellent choice of words, since the total cost was about $5,700 US dollars. That is almost three Vision Pros in today's money. It was a lot cheaper today, but eBay fees are still a trip, and I could use some help paying for all this from our sponsor, Ridge. It's almost Father's Day and Ridge is here to help you be the favorite child. Get something nice for your dad at their Father's Day sale with some items up to 40% off. Thank goodness he still had his kicking around. It supports up to 10 drives, including four internal hard drives. It's got support for four fans, two in the front, one in the back, one in the top.
